info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 12:32PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Bands of Snow and Rain Along The Rocky Mountain Front... At 1230pm MST, Doppler Radar indicated multiple bands of locally heavy snow or mixed precipitation along the Rocky Mountain Front. The bands of snow are oriented from west to east, moving slowly southward. Those driving along Highway 89 in Teton and Pondera Counties are likely to experience rapidly changing road conditions while passing through each of the bands of rain or snow. Expect reduced visibility below one half mile. Where snow is falling, snowfall rates could be up to one inch per hour. Strong wind gusts are also occurring through the area, so be prepared for difficult driving in crosswinds.
